description: A small, stocky parrot with a black head, white throat and chest, yellow thighs, and green wings. They are often described as clowns.
temperament: Extremely playful, energetic, and comical. They love to hop, dance, and wrestle with toys. Can be nippy and require consistent training.
loudness: Moderate to Loud. Not as piercing as larger parrots, but they have a high-pitched, sharp call that can be frequent.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Not known for talking ability. They are more likely to learn whistles, beeps, and other environmental sounds.
dietaryNeeds: High-energy birds that do well on a diet of pellets, fresh fruits, vegetables, and flowers. They can be picky eaters.
healthPointers: Generally hardy birds that can live 20-30 years. Ensure they have plenty of toys for chewing and energy-burning to prevent behavioral issues.
housing: Suitable for apartments with tolerant neighbors. They are active and need a spacious cage for their size, at least 24"W x 24"D x 30"H, with lots of toys and room to hop.
